title: One Piece's Eiichiro Oda Reveals Why Series Had Two-Year Timeskip
author: CBR Editorial
description: Article discussing Eiichiro Oda's reasoning for implementing the two-year timeskip. Oda explained that as a 17-year-old, Luffy had no way to defeat strong enemies like a Yonko, which is why they needed two years. He chose two years specifically because he didn't want to make Luffy that much of an adult.

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains discussion of post-timeskip power scaling

title: Did One Piece Really Fall Off After The Time Skip? Or Did You Just Grow Up?
author: CBR Editorial
description: Analysis article discussing how viewers who grew up with One Piece have often argued it takes a downturn following the timeskip, citing an increasingly mature tone and departure from adventurous whimsy in favor of exposition, worldbuilding, and political intrigue.

title: One Piece: A Complete Timeline
author: CBR Editorial
description: Comprehensive timeline article that notes the pre-timeskip era saw Luffy recruit the vast majority of the rookie Straw Hat Pirates before realizing he wasn't yet ready to achieve his dream. Set two years later, the post-timeskip era sees the Straw Hats now among the strongest pirates in the world.

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains complete series timeline including recent events

title: One Piece 3D2Y: Overcome Ace's Death! Luffy's Vow to His Friends
author: Toei Animation
description: Television special that takes place during the two-year timeskip beginning in Episode 516. The special shows events during Luffy's training on Rusukaina, including a threat to the island and Luffy's continued struggle with Ace's death. '3D2Y' refers to Luffy's coded message - the original plan was three days but now it's two years.

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Takes place during the timeskip, minimal spoilers beyond Episode 516
